title: Everyday English Course 94
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Would you like some carrots and beans, Mary?
W: No, I don't like them. I hate vegetables.
M: But darling, you have to eat them. They are good for your health.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Would you like some carrots and beans, Mary?
W: No, I don't like them. I hate vegetables.
M: But darling, you have to eat them. They are good for your health.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
M: Would you like some carrots and beans, Mary?
W: No, I don't like them. I hate vegetables.
M: But darling, you have to eat them. They are good for your health.
{a}

variables.a: What doesn't Mary like?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: What did you do?
W: Oh, I burned myself while I was cooking dinner.
M: Oh!
W: How about you?
M: I hurt myself while I was bowling.
W: Your back?
M: Yes.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: What did you do?
W: Oh, I burned myself while I was cooking dinner.
M: Oh!
W: How about you?
M: I hurt myself while I was bowling.
W: Your back?
M: Yes.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
M: What did you do?
W: Oh, I burned myself while I was cooking dinner.
M: Oh!
W: How about you?
M: I hurt myself while I was bowling.
W: Your back?
M: Yes.
{a}

answerOptions: She hurt her leg while bowling.
She hurt her back while bowling.

variables.a: What happened to the woman?
What does the woman ask the boy to do after school?
What is the relation between the two persons?
What is the probable relationship between the two speakers?
What does the man think about the vacation?
How much is one cup?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Can I come to see you at 10:00,Professor Wang? I wonder if you can help me with my paper.
M: I will be having a class then. Why not come 40 minutes later?
W: OK. See you then.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Can I come to see you at 10:00,Professor Wang? I wonder if you can help me with my paper.
M: I will be having a class then. Why not come 40 minutes later?
W: OK. See you then.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: Can I come to see you at 10:00,Professor Wang? I wonder if you can help me with my paper.
M: I will be having a class then. Why not come 40 minutes later?
W: OK. See you then.
{a}

answerOptions: To ask for a sick leave.
To get help with her paper.
instances.correctAnswer: To get help with her paper.

variables.a: does the woman want to see Professor Wang?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Where's Jane? It's two fifteen.
M: Yeah. We planned to meet here at two o'clock. Maybe she missed the train.
W: I can wait for another fifteen minutes. But then, I have to leave.
M: Okay, let's wait until two thirty.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Where's Jane? It's two fifteen.
M: Yeah. We planned to meet here at two o'clock. Maybe she missed the train.
W: I can wait for another fifteen minutes. But then, I have to leave.
M: Okay, let's wait until two thirty.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: Where's Jane? It's two fifteen.
M: Yeah. We planned to meet here at two o'clock. Maybe she missed the train.
W: I can wait for another fifteen minutes. But then, I have to leave.
M: Okay, let's wait until two thirty.
{a}

variables.a: When did the two speakers plan to meet Jane?

answerOptions: She must do something else at first.
She has an important appointment with her doctor.
instances.correctAnswer: She has an important appointment with her doctor.

variables.a: Why can't the woman go playing ping-pong ball right now?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: He finds the presentation hard to follow.
He speaks highly of the presentation.
instances.correctAnswer: He speaks highly of the presentation.

variables.a: What does the man think of professor white's presentation?
What will the man do first after class?
Where are the two speakers talking?

answerOptions: She knows the way to the bank.
She doesn't want to tell him the way.
She doesn't know the way, either.
instances.correctAnswer: She doesn't know the way, either.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

answerOptions: She bought a new set of furniture from Italy last month.
She still keeps some old furniture in her new house.
She plans to put all her old furniture in the basement.
instances.correctAnswer: She still keeps some old furniture in her new house.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

answerOptions: She is asking for a higher pay.
She is introducing a new friend.
instances.correctAnswer: She is asking for a higher pay.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Are you going to the shopping mall tonight?
W: Tonight? I have to study for my physics test that's tomorrow.
M: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Are you going to the shopping mall tonight?
W: Tonight? I have to study for my physics test that's tomorrow.
M: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
M: Are you going to the shopping mall tonight?
W: Tonight? I have to study for my physics test that's tomorrow.
M: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.
{a}

answerOptions: She will study with the man.
She cannot go with the man.
instances.correctAnswer: She cannot go with the man.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

answerOptions: She is listening to the music.

variables.a: What is the woman probably doing?

answerOptions: The man wants to go to San Francisco.
If the man board the plane to Los Angeles now, he will have to transfer at San Francisco.
There are two direct flights to Los Angeles within the next two hours.
instances.correctAnswer: If the man board the plane to Los Angeles now, he will have to transfer at San Francisco.

variables.a: What can we learn from the conversation?

answerOptions: The post office lost the book.
It was on the way for 3 years.
It was the man's boss' fault.
instances.correctAnswer: It was the man's boss' fault.

variables.a: Why did the woman get the book so late?

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Hi, John!
M: Oh, hello, Jenny!
W: I heard you received the top grade on all five exams last semester.
M: Only on four. I'm afraid.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Hi, John!
M: Oh, hello, Jenny!
W: I heard you received the top grade on all five exams last semester.
M: Only on four. I'm afraid.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: Hi, John!
M: Oh, hello, Jenny!
W: I heard you received the top grade on all five exams last semester.
M: Only on four. I'm afraid.
{a}

answerOptions: He only took the fourth exam.
He didn't get the highest score on one exam.
instances.correctAnswer: He didn't get the highest score on one exam.

variables.a: What does the man think of the exams?

answerOptions: To protect her from getting scratches.
To help relieve her of the pain.

variables.a: Why does the man suggest the woman wear long sleeves?

answerOptions: He will send someone right away.
He has to do other repairs first.
The woman can call later that day.
instances.correctAnswer: He has to do other repairs first.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

answerOptions: She is tired of the food in the canteen.
She often eats in a French restaurant.
She usually takes a snack in the KFC.
instances.correctAnswer: She is tired of the food in the canteen.

variables.a: What do we learn about the woman?
How much will the man pay for these tickets?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: What do you think of the opera?
W: It's very good. The actors and actresses are all very good. Don't you think so?
M: Yes. The acting is excellent and so is the music.
W: Yes. I like it very much.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: What do you think of the opera?
W: It's very good. The actors and actresses are all very good. Don't you think so?
M: Yes. The acting is excellent and so is the music.
W: Yes. I like it very much.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
M: What do you think of the opera?
W: It's very good. The actors and actresses are all very good. Don't you think so?
M: Yes. The acting is excellent and so is the music.
W: Yes. I like it very much.
{a}

variables.a: What do the two speakers think of the opera?

answerOptions: Jimmy will regret marrying a French woman.
Jimmy's words are often not reliable.
Jimmy is not serious in making decisions.
instances.correctAnswer: Jimmy's words are often not reliable.

variables.a: What does the man imply?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Would you like a cup of coffee?
W: Oh, I'd love one, please.
M: Well, I've got an idea. Why not go out and get one?
{a}

W: Oh, I'd love one, please.
M: Well, I've got an idea. Why not go out and get one?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: So, what do you usually do in your free time?
M: At the moment I'm spending much of my free time learning German. I also enjoy playing the piano.
W: Do you play any sports?
M: Not much. But I go to the sports club and work out once a week.
{a}

{a}

variables.a: What does the man mainly do in his spare time?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: How beautiful! How long have you had it?
M: Only two weeks.
W: How far have you been in it?
M: Not too far. Just to a picnic.
{a}
